lessons.title: UNIT R1.3 — The Commander Principle
lessons.desc: One consonant (the commander) decides how the vowel is read. You’ll start reading syllables.

data.title: The Commander Principle: One rule that explains everything
data.text:
Here's the magic:

The consonant (the Hero) decides how the vowel will sound.

Same vowel mark.
Different consonant = Different sound.

Why? Because the consonant is the COMMANDER.
It controls the tone.

Sun consonant + vowel = vowel sounds CLEAN
Moon consonant + same vowel = vowel sounds ALTERED (with E or O coloring)

data.question: Will they sound the same? Look at: ក + ា (Sun) vs គ + ា (Moon). Same vowel mark, different commander.
data.explanation:
Same vowel mark, but different commanders → different sounds.
Sun consonant (ក) → sound stays clear/light (kaa)
Moon consonant (គ) → sound changes, gets 'colored' by the deep tone (kea)

data.title: Right-side Vowels (Inventory)
data.text:
Some vowel marks sit to the RIGHT of the consonant like a cane.

In R1 you learn three:

• ា (Aa) — the most common
• ះ (Ah) — short, sharp stop
• ាំ (Am) — nasal tone

With Sun letters: ា→-aa, ះ→-ah, ាំ→-am
With Moon letters: ា→-ea, ះ→-eah, ាំ→-oam

Core rule: Sun + vowel = vowel sound stays clean; Moon + vowel = vowel shifts with E/O coloring.

data.question: Which pair matches the correct Sun vs Moon reading for ា (Aa)?
options: កា = kaa, គា = kea
កា = kea, គា = kaa
កា = kaa, គា = kaa
កា = kea, គា = kea
data.correct_answer: កា = kaa, គា = kea
data.explanation:
Sun (ក) keeps ា as -aa: កា = kaa
Moon (គ) shifts ា to -ea: គា = kea

data.hint: Moon Ko + ា (Aa mark) → Moon shift = kea
